comment: The beer ended up tasting pretty good going into the keg.  It has plenty of malt body and the Munich really shows in color and in taste.  The hops might be too bitter and dank at the beginning of the taste but they end up pretty crisp.  Next time I might nix the Columbus and try Amarillo or Simcoe with the same hop schedule.  Might also take out a half pound of malt or more to lower the abv. The beer I'd consider this closest to is the Phoenix Pale Ale by SlyFox.  All told, for the $19.50 I spent making a 3.5 gallon batch, this is awesome!
